We love all seasons but we especially love the winter.

Our Club provides all kinds of adventures year round. Please check out our past events and sign up future events.

Participants include adult men and women of all ages and physical condition.

FAQs:

How do I get a ride or offer rides?

Post on the comments section of the event that you are going to that you need or that you have space in your car. Please wait until at least two weeks before the event to ask for a ride. We try to carpool as much as we can because a lot of people don't have a car and it's more environmentally friendly.
results.name: New York Backpackers

results.description:
We are a diverse group of outgoing lacrosse playing fanatics coming together as a post collegiate women's lacrosse team in Manhattan. Practices weekly include plyos, sprints, and core workouts. We also keep in shape via group runs with a coach and gym workouts with a personal trainer. 

We travel to tournaments at least 4 times a year and participate in a spring and fall league.

We are competitive and like to win, but seriously, this is post-collegiate so winning doesn't really mean anything unless we're also having fun. That's why losing isn't such a big deal either.

﻿﻿﻿All skill levels are welcome. You won't be benched at games because of a "lack of skill". Everyone who attends will get as equal amount of playing time as possible.

The commitment required to be part of the team is minimum since this is NYC and everyone seems to lead busy lives beyond recreational sports. If you are unable to attend a single practice but can come to tournaments, great. If you are unable to attend a single game but can come to all the practices, wonderful. If we see you randomly just a few times a year, you'll always be welcome and we'll always be happy to see you as long as you're a good sport.

US Lacrosse Membership is absolutely required to participate in all tournaments, scrimmages, and games.

There is a $5.00 membership fee due upon joining the meetup group. A yearly $5.00 team membership fee is due each March 1st after that, regardless of when you joined the meetup group.

Follow the team on Twitter @centrallacrosse, and get to know Captains Deanna @runbeyonddreams and Althea @atrain1016.

We're also very social and usually have team get togethers off the field about once a month, if not more.
results.name: Central Lacrosse NYC: Women's Post Collegiate Lacrosse

results.description:

As many owners will agree, Boston Terriers are a very special breed. Perhaps we are biased, but we think they are the best! At our meetups, you will enjoy the fun of seeing dozens of funny, energetic and crazy Boston Terriers having a blast!

See you there!

results.description:
Power napping is an effective, well-documented method to increase wakefulness during the day. If you have to get by on very little sleep, learning to power nap can be an invaluable tool to stay awake and remain alert during the day.

Extreme power napping (also known as polyphasic sleep or Uberman's Sleep Schedule) involves getting most or all of your sleep from power naps without the need for chemicals such as caffeine. Many successful extreme nappers thrive on a total of two hours of sleep per day, often experiencing greater alertness and concentration than monophasic sleepers. Check out this youtube video for more information:

http://youtube.com/watch?v=TpSxXjLjL3M

Also of interest is this documentary by sleep researcher Claudio Stampi:

http://vvi.onstreammedia.com/cgi-bin/visearch?squery=+ClipID:5++VideoAsset:pbssaf105&query=sleep&user=pbs-saf
results.name: New York City Extreme Power Napping Meetup

results.description:
brandh@ckers digital insights workshop series

who we are

brandh@kers is a new york city workshop series since 2008 showcasing prominent and rising digital marketing and brand technology opinion leaders in the marketing and digital ad tech space. Embracing digital media and creative innovation brandh@ckers seeks to keep members abreast of technologies, innovations and digital platforms which effectively connect brands to consumers in ways that facilitate commerce. The Meetup calls these brandh@ckathons.

companies on our panels

brandh@cker panelists have included marketing, agency and technology professionals and "not-professionals" from the following companies:

Google,LivingSocial,IGN, Entertainment,MSL Group,ScoutMob,Pepsi,Nielsen Mobile,Yipit,Federated Media,Converseon,OutDoor Bound,Brand New World,MocoSpace,Appsavvy,MTV Networks,Hearst/iCrossing,Weber Shandwick,AKQA,R/GA,Whole Foods,Vitrue,Clickable,Buddy Media,Passenger,Havas Media Contacts,Audience Science,Porter Novelli,Econsultancy,AdMeld,Ketchum,Invite Media,Deep Focus,Digitas,Peer 39,LiveWorld,360i,Publicis,Carrot Creative

Have a "brandh@ck" or rising digital innovation star and panel idea you'd suggest for us? Forward the following info below to us and we'll see about getting you on one of our future brandhackathon panels: hack@brandhacker.com

· Speaker /Team Name

· Brand, Media, Technology Company Name/Overview

· Technology Type (mobile, social, online, etc.)

· Topic Idea (e.g. technology that advance brands/which brand)

· Website URL

· Twitter Handle

our program usually follows this outline:

6:00-7:00 - Pre-Networking
7:00-8:00 - Key Opinion Leader / Moderated Panel Discussion
8:00-8:30 - Audience Discussion / Q&A
8:30-9:00 - Post Networking

results.description:
Press inquiries please email: nycbeekeeping.net AT gmail.com

4/4/2014 PLEASE NOTE: Our Facebook account has been hijacked. Please take what appears there with a grain of salt.


Welcome to the 2015 Season!

We are busy in the field and it's a great learning year as we explore the "sustainable apiary" model. We welcome all Beekepers and Beelovers to participate with us! Join us for scheduled programs, get on the Actives list, or get in touch by email. There is plenty to do, lots to learn, and many ways to contribute!

Click here to get on the "Actives" list 

Please scroll down to read more and for calendar


Upcoming Events:

Beginner Mentoring Series and Aspiring Beekeeper Field Days : June 13th at East New York Farms (Partnering with Citizen's Committee), July 18th at Randall's Island, August 15th, more to come.

Those seeking a full season commitment can apply for Field Studies Group. Please email a letter of interest and a resume/CV so we can follow up with you to admin AT nycbeekeeping.org

We'll have a number of other useful workshops and harvest in season, and we will be doing a group order for Varroa treatment MAQS strips, so keep an eye on our calendar.

Save the date for:  Fall Walkabout Workshop August 7-9

Are you an organization that wants to team up to plan an activity with us? An individual or corporation that wants to give us some support? Please email admin AT nycbeekeeping.org

Please scroll down for Calendar and other ways to connect.

.

You can email by clicking the "Contact" link at left, or nycbeekeeping.net@gmail.com.

We're also now on twitter

Learn with us

Beekeepers and aspiring beekeepers, Jim's Winter Lecture series has wrapped up, and we are adding new learning options this year to our award-winning program.

Click here to learn more.

Connect with us:

Want to host a hive or bring other pollinators to your garden or rooftop, looking for honey from your neighborhood, or beekeeper seeking assistance? Want to join summer hands-on activities, harvest with us, or connect with a program for your school?

Get on the Actives List and let us know!


Conserve with us

To Support Bees & Beekeeping with a charitable donation, or to partner on corporate responsibility programs, please contact us.


Host a Hive inquiry form

We will try to match you with a beekeeper seeking a site.


Ready to Harvest? Click here!

Join a Community harvest! We have room for BeeLovers as well as BeeKeepers. It's always a celebration! You can get on the list now, and we'll be in touch as sessions are scheduled in season.

Honey & Hive Products  inquiry form

For honey or other products of the hive grown or made locally in NYC, please click here for an inquiry form and we will connect you in season.

IMPORTANT: Beekeepers, please remember to send your mandatory notice to the Dept of Health (more here) by March 31st, 2015.

Bee Rescue Hotline: 917-740-4BEE

April to June is typically "swarm season," when bee colonies naturally reproduce. Though we teach how to minimize swarming, there are no guarantees, and they may need to be collected. A swarm left undisturbed is typically calm as it awaits scouts bringing information about possible new homes.

If you see a swarm that needs a home - we may be able to help. Please call 917-740-4BEE (4233), tell us when & where, and leave contact info for followup. Please be as specific as you can & if possible send a photo to nycbeekeeping@gmail.com. A beekeeper will survey the situation and call in support if needed.

_______________________________________________________________________________________________

Come, learn, enjoy!

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

nycbeekeeping.org™ (NYC Beekeeping) is an all-volunteer conservation and education group for beekeepers and beelovers.

We organize beekeeper training, expert and peer mentoring, and community service & outreach activities throughout the year. We work with urban farms, community gardens, the NYC Parks Dept., schools and other organizations to foster a strong community of Responsible Urban Beekeepers, to bring training & economic opportunity through beekeeping to underserved areas, to conserve and protect honeybees and other pollinators, and to contribute to the program and fundraising capacities of selected 501(c)(3) organizations.
results.name: New York City Beekeeping                   nycbeekeeping.org

results.description:
You know who you are.



White Wolf gamers that are long in the tooth.



Cyberpunk players that remember 2013(!)



ADnD folk that still have 1st ed sheets somewhere.



We all played paper and LARP RPGs back in the day.



We may dust off polyhedral plastic once in a while, when our too-cool friends and colleagues aren't looking.



Our old game pals eBayed their books or went to crazytown and really believe they are sparkily vampires.



Bottom line is almost no one we (want to) know still games and we certainly can't find anyone to GM.



And face it, Neutral Ground is just creepy when you are 40! (actually, it always was...)

Now we are grownups with real jobs, spouses and (gasp!) offspring!



Wouldn't it be cool to find a casual RPG with non-scary, non-teenager players?

Maybe you don't actually game anymore. Perhaps you just miss the unique banter (and sad humor) that game groups share.

Lets talk.
results.name: NYC RPGeezers

results.description:
Ethan Ruby and Jeremy Schwartz founded Poker4Life in 2005. After hosting many charity poker tournaments at the Park Avenue Country Club in Manhattan, they realized how much of an impact poker can have in the world of charitable giving. Poker4Life was formed to harness The Positive Power of Poker by hosting charity poker tournaments to benefit all non-profit organizations. Our mission is to provide a forum for professional, celebrity and everyday poker players to come together and support causes they believe in while playing a game they enjoy.

Poker4Life has attracted thousands of poker players and philanthropists with our exclusive charity poker tournaments. Over the last six years we have raised over $1,000,000. Our charity of choice thus far has been The Buoniconti Fund to Cure Paralysis, which maintains an unprecedented 86 cents of every dollar going directly to research. There are approximately 1.4 million 501(c)(3) non-profit organizations in the U.S. with whom we are actively forming relationships. Our aim is to help them raise money through the great game of poker.

Poker4Life can host individual fundraisers for any non-profit organization, but our ultimate goal is an annual main event in which each participant plays for the charity of their choice. Our model ensures that every designated charity is a winner by receiving 10% of their representative's registration fee in addition to any distributed prize pool money.

Experience The Positive Power of Poker as Poker4Life redefines the charity poker world!
results.name: Poker4Life.org  'Who do you play for'

results.description:
This meetup is "going to the dogs"...Pugs to be precise!!!

Okay, so you're owned by a Pug; that goes without saying! I am too, as are many others. Why do we love these big-eyed, wrinkle-faced Pugsters so much? There are so many reasons, & that's reason enough to join the NNJPE!

Our steadily-growing group of friendly Pugaholics & their Pugs meet for outings once a month (with "special events" tossed in for good measure), in order to provide our furbabies (& ourselves) some time for socialization & out-in-out fun!

Playtime's great, but giving back to the community is also important, & we make a conscious effort to host & participate in charitable events; all net proceeds go to the featured organization. We are also active with Pug Rescue & in helping to find needy Pugs their "forever homes".

I encourage members to get involved; suggestions for outings are always welcome. Additionally, our message board is always available for any questions, comments, or concerns you might have in regard to the care & maintenence of your beloved four-legged family member!

Well; why wait any longer? If you "Got Pug", then get going & join the NNJPE today! We're looking forward to meeting you!


Kind Regards,
Ellen
Group Organizer, NNJPE

results.description:
At The NY Horror Movie Group you will meet other local Horror Movie fans to go see horror films, analyze horror movies and maybe even get together for a few drinks after the movie.

This is perhaps the best part of our lovely meetup. This is your chance to meet other people who LOVE horror and exchange ideas, anecdotes, laugh about bad flicks you've seen, and much more?! Also we focus on creating a unique and wonderful atmosphere at every event.

There is a $13.00 annual fee (fee covers you from January 1st thru December 31st of the current year). What do you get for $13.00 a year? A lot.

These are some of benefits of being member of our group:

  • FREE MOVIE SCREENINGS during the year
  • Visits to horror conventions
  • FREE prizes (yup Free prizes folks)
  • At least once a week an event to attend (so no excuses for you- we are a very active group...)
  • FREE Raffle of DVD movies and collector items
  • FREE magazines
  • Horror Parties
  • Meet some of our special members who are: actors, directors, working on special effect, writers, singers, cameraman, prop department, and more
  • Read reviews written by the members on www.horrorgoreandmore.com
  • Participate on our FIRST FILM (in pre-production at the moment)
  • Meet DIRECTORS and CAST MEMBERS of future films at EXCLUSIVEQ&A we get invited to!!!
  • PLUS we have members who found true love in our group (that's an A+ on my book)
  • But if you don't find "the one" you still get to hang out among the coolest people who enjoy, appreciate and share their passion for this genre.

So? what are you waiting for? Sign up! Come to our events, let's watch a movie, and while you are at it, make some friends and have FUN. Be part of THE #1 HORROR GROUP (and the oldest) on the NET

:: PLEASE MAKE SURE TO READ OUR MEMBER RULES & POLICIES (LOCATED IN "ABOUT US" PAGE) AS THEY WILL ENFORCE, LINK BELOW ::

http://www.meetup.com/nychorror/about/

We are a non-flakey Meetup so three "no shows" or four months of inactivity - unfortunately, it could lead to your removal from the group. 

Membership is at Organizer's discretion.  We prefer quality over quantity!

results.description:
NYCMB is for anyone that shares a passion for mountain biking and trail riding. We are a fully volunteer/no charge/no profit like minded group of people who simply gather to share experiences, discover and explore all the wonderful bike trails in our area that nature has to offer and of course, make new friends.

We try to plan different events for all levels of riders, so you don't have to be a downhill racer to be a part of this group. But we do have some pretty strong riders that definitely will make sure you have a great workout if that's what you're after.

We ride as a group to enjoy the event together so no one gets left too far behind and no one is pushed beyond their comfort level.

>>>We ride through woods on fairly rugged terrain so a true "fat tire" mountain bike, preferably with front suspension, is required. A Hybrid bike will not be enough for most of the places we ride.<<<

If someone is tired and can't keep up, they won't be left alone. If someone has a problem with their bike, they'll usually have 3 or 4 other riders vying to help fix it. If someone's hurt, they and their bike will be helped back to the trailhead and home if needed.

No doubt you'll find that mountain bikers are the best kinda people.

 

Are you what we consider a Beginner, Intermediate or an Advanced rider?

Click here to find out:

http://www.meetup.com/NYCMTB/messages/boards/thread/10167809/

Email: LIRawVegans-list@meetup.com
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/LIRawVegans
Pinterest: http://www.pinterest.com/LIRawVegans/pins

By joining our meetup group you are becoming a part of our vibrant, caring, and supportive community. We promote healthy raw food in its natural state, not processed or purified, and stay away from 'junk' foods loaded with trans fats, artificial chemicals, sugar, sodium, and genetically modified wheat, corn, and soy ingredients. Come to our potlucks and try our raw organic vegan  pizza, sweet pies, chocolate cakes, hearty and nourishing soups, ice cream, fresh salads and fruit, juices and smoothies. Get healthy, detoxify, learn from our raw food experts and gain access to our raw vegan recipes and health tips. Please read Why Join a Raw Vegan Group?

This group is open to ALL from 'herbivores' and health-conscious vegans to 'omnivores' who are just curious about raw organic vegan food.  Very few of us are 100% raw vegans, the majority of members are mostly vegans and vegetarians. Our focus is on optimal health, well-being, vitality, and longevity.

We offer raw vegan food potlucks, raw food classes, nature walks and hikes, foraging trips, picnics, beach parties, and outdoor exercise classes. Meet our group organizers and active members and subscribe to our informative mailing list and message board.

We are encouraging you to become an event organizer. Please contact us if you are interested. Otherwise, participate in our events and bring raw organic dish. Check our raw vegan recipes. If you don't have time to prepare a dish, here is a list of places where you can purchase organic raw vegan food on Long Island.


 We are looking forward to meeting you at one of our events!

results.description:
Celebrating 5 Years   of Success!!

The HR Alliance Chooses Seasoned HR Leader,
Ann Marie Morris, As Its New President
Click here for details 

The HR Alliance is a professional development and networking association that assists Human Resources practitioners in broadening their business networks and sharing their knowledge and expertise to stay current on the latest trends, strategies, and best practices in the human resources field. 

We have a strong active membership that includes Senior HR Directors, Generalists, Specialists, Consultants, Service Providers, Business Owners, and people interested in learning more about the dynamic field of Human Resources.

Our events are designed to address the challenges Human Resources leaders face in today's shifting business environment. These interactive programs focus on exchanging best practices and discussing critical HR issues with peers. 

HR Alliance members join for the purpose of exchanging ideas. Most understand that the greatest benefits are gained from exposure to other HR Alliance members. Our meetings are the ideal format for such an exchange and will provide a unique experience to everyone who participates. 

Get started now, click here to sign up for our next event.


****************************************************************************
We do have a few requirements for members:

  1. You must be an HR professional
  2. You must compete ALL of your profile questions to be considered for membership
  3. RSVP to events when they are posted (even if you cannot attend)
  4. Be respectful in regards to your RSVP's (saying "yes" and then not showing is not "cool")

  So, is The HR Alliance for you???  

Click on a link below to learn more:

ABOUT US

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

****************************************************************************

Please note, our regularly scheduled monthly events are not designed for vendors, service providers, coaches or non HR related professionals. Please be keep this in mind be respectful when you RSVP

MEMBER BENEFITS

Monthly Events
Through meetings and events, The HR Alliance offers members structured face-to-face professional development and networking opportunities. All of our events are interactive, facilitated by Human Resource experts and address current topics and emerging trends.  

Newsletter
The monthly e-newsletter for members features event summaries, timely articles on HR topics, member highlights,  job opportunities and HR product and services.  

Message Boards
Members can use this dedicated forum  to communicate with one another and share knowledge, ideas and best practices.  

Professional Development
The HR Alliance offers HRCI approved online training courses available for members at discounted prices.  

HR Marketplace
Services providers and vendors can sponsor events and advertise their products and/or services to the membership. 

Special Discounts
Members can take advantage of special discounts and offers from sponsors and HR partner organizations.

WHO SHOULD JOIN?

HR Professionals
We define an HR professional as someone who works in an internal HR department for a company. These roles include, HR Directors, HR Managers, HR Generalists, HR Specialists (Benefits, Compensation, Talent Development etc.)HR consultants will be considered on a case by case basis.

HR Consultants
We define an HR consultant as someone who provides guidance, direction and expertise on HR and Human Capital Management specific issues.

Vendor/Service Provider
We define a vendor or service provider as someone who works for an organization that provides HR products and solutions. This includes, recruiters, coaches, trainers, benefit providers, HR outsourcers, insurance, communications etc.

Students
Graduate level students pursuing a degree related to Human Resources.
results.name: THE HR ALLIANCE

results.description:
Hello all,

My name is Daniel Szyper. I have been the organizer of this group since June 2009. I diagnosed myself with Asperger Syndrome in 1997 and had it clinically confirmed in 1998. I started an adult Asperger's Syndrome support group in Phoenix, AZ in 2002 that thrives to this day. In April of 2008 I moved back to NJ after a nine-year absence, and began attending meetings of the Princeton Asperger Syndrome Meetup, which David Boticelli, the previous organizer of this group, had recently started.

Asperger's Syndrome is a form of autism that involves a variety of symptoms that include:

-Difficulty having one-on-one relationships,
-Following a strict schedule,
-A fascination with one topic in particular,
-Taking things literally that should be taken figuratively,
-Hypersensitivity to loud noises and odors,
-Inability to show facial expressions and body language,
just to name a few.

Please keep in mind that I am not a mental health professional and I cannot diagnose anyone. But if you have been diagnosed with Asperger's Syndrome, think you may have AS or know someone who has AS, I invite you to join this group. We meet once a month and can discuss the symptoms of Asperger's Syndrome, whether or not you or someone you know has been diagnosed with it or may have it, discuss personal experiences and possible treatments. I hope with this group, members can gain a better understanding of this disorder.

Thank you.

Your organizer,

Daniel Szyper

results.description:
THIS GROUP IS CURRENTLY NOT ACTIVE

This meetup group is for people who would like to explore New York’s “fine dining.” The dinners range from $80 to over $300, depending on what you order. Tip and tax add 30% to your individual bill. We mostly do tasting menus, and some people prefer wine pairings as well.

Please sign up for a meetup only if you are willing to make the same commitment to the group as if it were a date with friends or family. The group size is either 4 to 6 or sometimes up to 8 people. Reservations in a fine dining restaurant cannot always be changed easily or be adjusted to a smaller table on a short notice. Also the organizer is always required to hold the reservation with a credit card. Members who reserve a spot, hold the reservation for weeks and cancel close to the date for a second time will be removed.

This meetup group requires to post a headshot and to use your real first name, as this is a very friendly and personal group.

Restaurants we visited include i.e. Dovetail, Morimoto, Corton, Blue Hill, Eleven Madison Park.

Cell phone policy: If you have to make a phone call, please do it before or after the dinner. Otherwise, please leave your device in your bag and NOT on the table.

Since the Meetup subscription is not free, I am charging $2 or $3 per person per dinner to recoup the costs. I am not making a profit.
results.name: The New York "Fine Dining" Meetup Group (age 35 to 55)

Historical description:
GNU and Linux are two of the most prominent examples of free software development. In the spirit of community-built software, twice a month we get the local community together to discuss topics of free, libre and open source software, the GNU/Linux operating system, ways to engage in the free software movement, and projects we are involved in. The NYC GNU/Linux meetup is a diverse group. The regulars are both from the free software community, and curious uninitiated. The meetup is a great way to get to know other GNU/Linux users, and professionals, and a nice way to bring local to a largely internet connected community.

We'd love to hear you present on the topic of your choice! Please review our presentation FAQ (http://www.meetup.com/standardista/pages/Presentation_FAQ/) to get started. *Not Just Moms* is a community for organizers of play groups, mom groups, and parenting groups.


Every member of this group is either a current or former organizer of a mom-related group.


If you organize a group for moms, playgroups or families and you wish that you had a group that you could turn to that understands your challenges and could offer advice and support then this is the group for you!


NJM focuses on passing the amazing knowledge and ideas of veteran organizers to the next generation.  Many of our members were organizers when Meetup first started and have helped us to assemble an extensive knowledge base of how to guides and best practices that will help you to run all aspects of your group. Any new org will find the help and support that you get in this group to be invaluable. 


What we offer:

- Quarterly organizer pow wows which meet in person in the NY metro area

- Weekly idea shares with an online component so if you don't live in NY you can still participate 

- A message board containing over 7,000 conversations, all relating to organizing.  Search to find your answer or post for help if you can't find it

results.description:
Read a good book. Meet new and interesting people who've read it too.  Feed your brain...and your stomach.

For a list of our past reads, please see the calendar or the photo album.  Our focus is on finding worthwhile literature and still covering a variety of eras, countries and fiction (and once in a while, non-fiction) genres.  We try to find books that are a manageable length (200-350 pages) and that make us think.

(Our members are well-educated, but note that the majority of us do not have English/literature degrees.  We are just smart people who like a good book and meeting new friends.)

We sit in smaller groups at the restaurants - usually 4-8 people per table, so that everyone can participate in a friendly, pressure-free environment and get to know the others at their table.

Helpful hints:

results.description:
THIS IS NEW YORK CITY TENNIS!

We're the largest tennis Meetup group on Earth, and the most active one in the greater New York City metropolitan area, so if you love tennis or if you just want to try it out, you're in the right place!

Week in and week out (weather permitting), we're out on the courts playing tennis, and whether you want to play sets, just hit around and have fun, work on your game, or take lessons with a licensed pro...you'll find plenty of fun, friendly people interested in exactly the same thing. So come join us and make new friends, get some fresh air and exercise, and have an awesome time!

SOCIAL TENNIS MEETUPS

We host full weekends of social tennis meetups, where we welcome everyone from advanced beginners to just plain advanced players...it's a friendly, casual environment, and we all just want to have fun and enjoy the game we love.

Please do be aware that whenever the courts are crowded (which is much of the time), we stick to playing doubles in order to make sure everyone gets as much court time as possible. There are often opportunities for singles, though, generally either early in the morning or later in the afternoon, and in the summer, sometimes in the middle of the day. And on very rare occasions, when we aren't able to get enough courts, we have to take turns rotating on and off. Usually, though, it's all tennis and all fun all the time!

TENNIS LESSONS and SERVICES

We also offer tennis lessons, so if interested in raising your game to a new level or you just want to know your current level...just ask.

EVERYTHING ELSE YOU NEED TO KNOW

Whether you attend our social tennis meetups or take lessons...all you need to bring is your racquet and whatever you'd like to eat or drink (fountain water on-site), we provide most everything else. More details, including directions, are included in all our event descriptions.

We also organize some non-tennis events throughout the year to give our tennis members a chance to mingle during bad weather and to meet other cool people who might not play.

We look forward to seeing you all, both on the courts and off!

P.S. Every once in a while, someone joins the group for the sole or primary purpose of promoting their own projects, businesses, ventures, or ideology. Solicitation, spam and all kinds of advertising and promotion are expressly prohibited. This includes, but is not limited to, posting to the message board, direct emails to other members, and comments on other members' profiles. We reserve the right to remove any member for violating this rule. If you feel that someone is engaging in any such behavior, please let us know and we will handle the situation immediately.
results.name: New York City Tennis

results.description:
It's not easy contemplating or going through a divorce. This meetup is designed for people who are seeking information, support, and guidance about how to make it through divorce wisely--amicably, cost-effectively, respectfully, and protective of children and important bonds.

We will discuss the pros and cons of litigation versus collaborative practice versus mediation and help you decide which approach is best for you and your circumstances.  We will discuss the process and how it works, tips on how to be most effective when discussing the issues, and ways to reduce your stress during the process.

Finally, if you have children, this meet-up can be especially helpful.  We will discuss the risks of divorce to children, which factors increase and decrease these risks, and what you can do to protect your children from the negative impact of divorce.  In particular, we will discuss ways to keep the children out of the middle, communicate effectively versus harmfully with your ex-spouse, and ways to preserve important bonds if at all possible so that the two of you can have a positive and supportive co-parenting relationship after the divorce.

And, of course, since it's your meet-up, if you have something else on your mind, we can talk about that, too, and I'll help in whatever way I can.

Please join us.  Information is power.  And support is magical.

Kind regards,

Judie
results.name: NYC Divorce Mediation and Children & Divorce Group

results.description: OUR GROUP'S PURPOSE Play in courts throughout New York City, meet other local volleyball players, make new friends and teammates and build the sport of volleyball. OUR LEVELS In order to match players with their correct group and maximize everyone's experience, here are our group's game titles and their descriptions. Trainee - Players learning the basics of the game. Slower game pace will help players get the hang of passing, setting, and hitting. Recreational - Players possessing basic skills/fundamentals of the game. Faster, yet laid-back game with focus on repetition of the basics. Competitive - Players with firm understanding of game strategy and a few years of experience. 5-1 / 6-2 formation experience a MUST. Advanced - Players with high level of experience: varsity starters, club players, or you grew up on the beach. Very fast game pace. Elite - Players that dominate an advanced game. INSTRUCTIONS RSVP for a game that is your appropriate level. Pre-pay with Paypal to guarantee yourself a spot. If you pre-pay the day of a game, print a copy of your paypal receipt and bring it with you. Walk-ins should come 15 minutes early. Dress appropriately.

results.description:
This group is dedicated to provide information and experience on how to live a powerful life with any time of meditation, mental discipline or trance based experience.  Our topics will include a broad range, including, certifications, philosophies, mind expanding experiences, etc.

Meditation From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia This article is about the mental discipline. For the form of alternative dispute resolution, see Mediation. For other uses, see Meditation (disambiguation). A statue of the Buddha meditating, Borim Temple, Korea

Meditation refers to any of a family of practices in which the practitioner trains his or her mind or self-induces a mode of consciousness in order to realize some benefit.[1][2][3]

Meditation is generally an internally-invoked, personal practice, which an individual can do by themselves. Prayer beads or other ritual objects may be used during meditation. Meditation may involve invoking or cultivating a feeling or internal state, such as compassion, or attending to a specific focal point. The term can refer to the state itself, as well as to practices or techniques employed to cultivate the state.[4]

There are dozens or more specific styles of meditation practice;[3] the word meditation may carry different meanings in different contexts. Meditation has been practiced since antiquity as a component of numerous religious traditions, especially, in Western countries, in monastic settings. In the Eastern spiritual traditions such as Hinduism and Buddhism, meditation is more commonly a practice engaged in by many, if not most, believers.

A 2007 study by the U.S. government found that nearly 9.4% of U.S. adults (over 20 million) had practiced meditation within the past 12 months, up from 7.6% (more than 15 million people) in 2002.[5]

Since the 1960s, meditation has been the focus of increasing scientific research of uneven rigor and quality.[6] In over 1,000 published research studies, various methods of meditation have been linked to changes in metabolism, blood pressure, brain activation, and other bodily processes.[7][8] Meditation has been used in clinical settings as a method of stress and pain reduction.[9][10]
results.name: "Meditation NYC"

results.description:
NYC-EFT-Energy-Psychological-Spiritual-Healing-Meetup

New York City Meetup group facilitated by healer psychologist, intuitive Dr. Jay Kantor - http://drjaykantor.com .

PsycheTherapeutics:  Breakthrough Methods For Achieving Profound Body-Mind-Spirit Transformation

  With Dr. Jay Kantor

In this meetup, you will learn about 3 breakthrough methods of body-mind-spirit healing which make it possible to work through current life crises and to overcome persistent, long-term psychological, emotional, and relationship issues.  These methods have proven successful even when conventional talk and drug therapies have previously failed.

Join Dr. Jay Kantor to understand and experience:

1)  EFT – a meridian-based, energy tapping therapy for quickly neutralizing energetic, emotional, and physical disturbances.  EFT – Emotional Freedom Techniques – is most likely THE breakthrough therapy of our times.

2)  PsychoClarity - a rapid, effective means for developing a conscious healing and nurturing relationship with traumatized, immature, conflicted, dissociated aspects of the personality.  Wholeness and integration of the personality is accomplished as the Higher Self is empowered to take charge of the person’s life.  Dis-identification with painful. limited aspects of the personality is achieved.

3)  Rohun Spiritual Psychotherapy - a spiritual and energy healing process for systematically purifying the chakras and aura.  Consciousness is transformed and enlightened by gently releasing the stuck energies, negative consciousness, and trauma in the body-mind-spirit system.

Individual and group exercises, and demonstrations will be offered to foster an experiential understanding of these methods.

Dr. Jay Kantor became interested in healing, metaphysics, and spirituality in the late 1960’s,  He started channeling in 1970 and took his first healing course in 1975 with Barbara Brennen, the author of the ground-breaking book Hands of Light.  Jay holds a Doctorate in Psychology from Columbia University and became a staff writer for Whole Life Times, the first national holistic magazine in the country, in 1980.

Jay’s career has included scientific research, journalism, clinical practice as a healer-therapist-intuitive, and teaching.  Jay published his own holistic magazine, Quality Times, in NY and NJ from 1990 to 2000.  He has interviewed over 100 of the most famous holistic authors in America, including Carolyn Myss, Ram Dass, Dr. Bernie Siegel, and Dr. Brian Weiss.  As a holistic journalist, Jay keeps himself at the cutting edge of developments in the field, and has studied many therapies with their originators

.Websites:   http://DrJayKantor.Com, http://EFTNJ.Com   http://Rohun.Com, http://SelfReparenting.Com

results.description:
Meet other people who are interested in and support accessibility and disability rights.

Make new friends and coordinate to improve and protect the rights of all individuals to full community, public and private sector access.

Our intentions are to work towards forming a non-profit group with a mission of educating the public about the importance of and their role in furthering the cause of inclusive design providing access for all.

Equal opportunities for persons with disabilities are guaranteed civil rights. They are Human Rights.

For example, in the United States, Federal and State laws protect the rights of people with disabilities and cover most situations including, but not limited to the:
- process involved in seeking and maintaining employment;
- proper and full access to State and local government services and programs
- proper access to public accommodations and commercial facilities (i.e.: businesses which serve the public)
- rights to effective transportation, etc.

We must come together and work to open up all aspects of community life to all those who may wish to participate...

It's right, it makes sense, it's the law!

results.description:
Meet other people interested in Zen Meditation.  Zen is not a path of devotion, nor opposed to any faith: Just watching the breath and being aware of being aware.

Weekly sits are held on Wednesday (three sits in a row with five minute breaks) and Friday (two twenty-five minute sits with walking meditation in between).   there are occasional exceptions--no sits in any location from Tuesday, August 18 through Sunday, August 23,  because a meditation retreat called a sesshin will be in progress.

Some come every week and others just come when they can.  The extent of commitment is personal. Anyone who attends any sit wearing loose, comfortable clothing will be shown how to sit on the cushion and how to follow the breath. If it is possible to come a few minutes early the first time, that would be helpful.

Cold Mountain Sangha  is presently based in Lucy Stone Hall at 54 Joyce Kilmer Avenue on the Livingston campus of Rutgers University in Piscataway.    For the most current schedule of sits and locations, more information about our teacher and the sangha, please check: coldmountainzen.org.

If you have other questions, you can also call 908-403-1851 between six and seven pm on any sit evening.

Our initial goal is to learn to live in the moment by experiencing a deepening of our concentration over time.  There is no charge for coming to our sits.  Any person who would like to experience the beauty, peace, and connectedness of just sitting in silence with other people is encouraged to come and sit with us.  Once you know where we are, no rsvp is necessary. All you have to do is show up.
results.name: The Piscataway Zen Meditation Meetup

results.description:
Join our growing community in a sacred celebration of Spirit.

Learn the basic techniques of core shamanism as you journey to meet your Spirit Guides and Power Animals. Deepen your shamanic practice through drumming, chanting, and movement at our monthly Shamanic Circle.

Meet other local people to learn, discuss, and use shamanic techniques for healing; talk about global healing, books, drums, and rituals.

Our Open Circle meet every second Friday of each month.

We also offer a Women Circle, Sound Circle, Healing Circle, 

We have Monthly workshops and other teachings, see details on our website and on facebook.

Open to all levels and all traditions.

Please bring a drum or a rattle, a pen & notepad, and a bandanna.
You may want to bring a pillow, blanket to use when we journey.

Suggested donation: $20

LOCATION: Open Circle - Women's Circle - Healing Circle

YoGanesh Yoga – 208 W 29th St, The 2nd Floor, #201

Between 7th & 8th Avenues

SOUND CIRCLE LOCATION: WellBody - 5th floor - Suite 521

22 East 17th Street, New York, NY

http://NYShamanicCircle.org/

https://www.facebook.com/NYShamanicCircleNYSC

WHO WE ARE

The core NYSC group has been practicing shamanic healing and journeying work every week since 1997. We work and study with a wide range of powerful traditional indigenous and Contemporary Western shamans from around the world.

NYSC MISSION

NYSC promotes and supports a shamanic community in New York City. Through our regular gatherings and workshops with shamans from around the world, NYSC seeks to promote earth-honoring living in ways that foster environmental, social and spiritual balance.

Looking ahead, our vision is to establish the New York Shamanic Center, the home for all of NYSC's events, activities and gatherings, including an Annual New York Shamanic Film Festival.
results.name: New York Shamanic Circle

results.description:
Ever wanted to do something out of your comfort zone and didn?t want to wait for friends to make a decision to join up?� Awesome Things to do was formed for that reason in mind while saving some cash.� Organizers look at deals offered by discount websites and turn them into events so you don't have to go at it alone and oftentimes ? it?s an even better deal when we have a group rate.� We're fun, well-organized, and aren't afraid to speak up to vendors who do not hold up to their end of the deal.� Most of all, we're sociable.� Damn it, we are sociable.

We enjoy making new friends and hope that you meet some great people in this group: just try not to flake and remember to chip in for gas/ tolls.

The following is a taste of what's out there (typical adventures are beginners/ intermediate):

  • Hiking
  • Kayaking
  • Hang Gliding
  • White Water Rafting
  • Skydiving
  • In/Outdoor Rock Climbing
  • Eating (Peruvian Cow's Heart anyone?)
  • Go-Karting
  • Paintballing
  • Biking
  • Volunteering
  • Sailing
  • Restaurant Week
  • Cooking Competitions & Demos
  • Traveling

We've been there, done that, and would love to do it again (well, maybe not the cow's heart).

*Joint events with other Meetup Groups are always welcome!

*Any member who catches a good deal online from Groupon, Zozi or has some great idea and want to share an experience with new people are welcome to suggest it here.

*Any member who RSVP "Yes" have read and agree to the Hold Harmless Agreement here.

results.description:
Calling all Atheists, Agnostics, FreeThinkers, Humanists, Secularists, Brights, Skeptics, Philosophers, and those who are questioning religion.

Gotham Atheists is about secular, science, and social human interactions.
Being secular in your approach to life, science minded in your decision making and know we are social humans for a kind, easy going, and helpful group that you want to belong to.

With your effort in joining Gotham Atheists you can say your helping push society a little more to a secular world. Come to any of our featured Gotham Atheists events or attend any of the wider secular events we list for you that happen in New York City.

You can support the Gotham Atheists by being member or just a supporter with your donation. The best type of nation is a donation!

Come join the Gotham Atheists Working Group to help plan our full schedule of events, happenings, gatherings, and open discussions. You can help in many different ways at the level of time, talent, and treasure you want.

Gotham Atheists endeavors to show society that we are free from believe and so much more. We are kind, nice, and helpful just as everyone one else Is in society.
That our view on dealing with government at all level that it be done without any religious practice and ritual. Gotham Atheists tenant of meaning is the separation of the religious church, temple, synagogs, and mosks from government be fulfilled.

Join Today!
G Enjoy Today!

Gotham Atheists is a highly social group for you to get to know other members. Enjoy their company, learn from others, and be friendly to each other.
Life should be nice!

We also want to have secular activist, book authors, educators, and government leaders to our featured discussion forum. We plan on these at venues that you will enjoy. Each event will have time for you to interact with other members.

DWA, Drinking With Athests will be every Friday Night as it as for the last 8 years.
DWA is purely a social night with no agenda but socializing and enjoying each others company for a few hours each week.

Gotham Atheists is also a member of Reasonable New York and we encourage you to attend any event you want. Check them out at reasonablenewyork.com

Welcome to the Meetup portal for NYC based Open Tai Chi. We invite you to meet and practice friendly Tai Chi Chuan. We offer quality courses in Yang Form, Qigong, Push Hands (Tui Shou), Meditation and I-Ching (Book of Changes). We also have periodic workshops and related programs as may be calendared.

We strive to cultivate a friendly and fun atmosphere, and a few events are conducted in an informal setting. All are welcome, from absolute beginners to any mind-body / martial arts people.

Classes are taught by our longtime practitioner and principle instructor, Inoshi. On occasion other experienced practitioners may assist beginners in these arts as well. Dress comfortably in clothes which you can move freely in. Street clothes are fine (changing areas available). Please see specific class descriptions for more detail, especially on footwear.

Please call us to arrange a intro class and to learn about our programs: 646-801-9218. Note: our classes are not free.

Our foundation is Yang Family / Style Tai Chi, yet includes practice from other families. We meet weekly with the exception of a possible Summer break, a Winter break and few major holidays.  Note: Tai Chi oft appears rendered Taiji.

Open Tai Chi is a branch of Unu Wellness Network. For wider interests see Unu's portal too: http://www.meetup.com/unu-wellness/

1) To have read, or be currently reading, "The Four Hour Work Week".
2) Applying some of the principles now.
3) Completed the dreamlining worksheet (page 57 of the book).
4) Identified at least one muse you're involved with.

results.description:
Has your circle of friends become smaller because of various lifestyle factors? Are you new to the neighborhood and looking to meet new people? Have you lived in Bay Ridge but find yourself looking to make new friends? If you answered "yes" to any of these questions, this group is perfect for you!

Doug started this group to create a way for people living in Bay Ridge to meet and develop new and true friendships. If you live outside of Bay Ridge you are also welcome!  Though most of our activities have taken place in Bay Ridge they are not limited to the area. Our activities over the years have included dinners and brunches at many of the great local restaurants, happy hours exploring new and well established bars, bowling, pool, cemetery tours and picnics in our beautiful parks.  We welcome any suggestions you have for future activities. While it costs Doug money to maintain this group, he does not pass those costs to the members. We also do not receive kickbacks from any venue that we meet in.

As a member of the Bay Ridge Friends we ask is that you pledge to :

1 . Be kind and respectful to other members of the group. We hope this never happens but the organizers will remove anyone deemed to be disruptive and/or disrespectful from the group.

2. Make an effort to be welcoming to new members. We don't want cliques as it defeats our purpose. If you see someone being shy, go up and say "Hello."

3. Respect the RSVP! If you cannot make an event you RSVP'd "yes" to please let us know. We understand you may have a busy schedule and your plans may change so make sure you change your RSVP, especially if it a time or space-sensitive event. We do keep track of "no shows". Guests are more than welcome to attend but please include them in your RSVP.

Also, remember, when you make friends with people in the group, put in the effort to maintain the friendship. That's what this group is about-FRIENDS!

Remember when applying for membership to please fill out our questionnaire. If you don't, you won't be accepted. We'd lke to know a little about you. You may be wondering why one of the questions asks about your age. The reason is we want to make sure this group is appropriate for you. All our members are 24 or older.
results.name: The Bay Ridge Friends Meetup Group

results.description: Westchester's Serendipity Singles Group is here to connect you with singles from all over Westchester County & the tri state areas. Possibly even meet that special someone. RSVP for our next meetup if you haven't already!

results.description:
Our focus is somewhat different from other Reggae groups...our members have sophisticated and eclectic taste in music! We'll be dropping in on the newest scenes where you can dance or just chill listening to great music in fantastic locations.

You're A Rocker If...

You just love ALL forms of Reggae music but also like a wide range of different music like Soca, Kompa, Salsa, Meringue, Hip-Hop, Soft-Rock, Afro-beat Tech and more. You're a Rockers if you enjoy going out to make new friendship connections and socialize!

Important Group Rules- A must read before joining!

All members are required to follow simple group rules: A. You must live in the NY tri-state area or close enough by to attend events. B. Join as a person and post a picture of yourself...using company names, logos, album covers or any form of advertising is not permitted. If you want to advertise in-box event organizers for information about sponsorship packages or contact meetup.com; C. RSVP to events posted and be prepared to participate, D. Plan to attend at least 3 events per year and always keep your RSVP up to date. Members who make a habit of not participating or not showing up at the last minute may be removed from the group without warning.

What You Can Expect!

Expect to have fun! For your enjoyment, we will list events in credible venues hosted by credible promoters and to spice up our lineup we'll get together with other meetup groups. All you do is RSVP YES--we'll take care of the details. Plan to give your social calender a fresh jolt!

Excellent Reggae Groups To Support!

Concerts/Showcases/Unique Events

http://www.meetup.com/livereggaenyc

HOT Reggae & Dancehall Parties/ Select Special Events

http://www.meetup.com/DancehallandReggaeAlliance

Strictly Roots & Culture Vibez

http://www.meetup.com/nycrootsreggae

Praise

http://www.meetup.com/reggaegospel

results.description:
A fun and social group of Heterosexual Catholic Singles ages 35--only 65. who are looking to meet other single people, Like never been married, divorced, & widow/widowed, to create new friendships. If you are separated, well then you aren't single, you are still married. so then our Meetup isn't for you.  Just saying.

In addition, we take it serious when we say, we would like to go out and have fun meet new friends. Therefore, we do hope you do too. However, our events entails of doing a variety of things like having a multiple Meetup events, Dancing, Listening to Music, going to Comedy Shows, going out to Dinner, seeing  Live Entertainment, Movies etc. We even sometimes do Meetup Events in Staten Island NY too.                     Please do let us see what your interests are and the other Meetup groups (if you belong to any) so we can know more about you. If you do not you would not be accepted. There is nothing wrong with doing that, there is nothing to hide. In addition, a Photo of Yourself (updated one) would be nice. Take a Selfie. Not one of your Pet (We love pets, I have a dog that my parents adopted him from a Animal Rescue in our area on Jan, 2012 he is now a part of our family), or a even Cartoon, Sceneryetc... If you do not have a photo of yourself, then you would not be accepted. Also, please do keep the send an Message  in. (Which the Meetup HQ's changed a few things like instead of a send a E-mail to, send a message it's up above.and you will get a notice in your E-mail that someone Sent you a message). Therefore, just in case we would like to get in touch with you, we have a way to do so, even if other members wants to do it also.  Another thing do not put any Personal information down as if for example, Phone’s or evens your e-mail address even websites to promote. Plus No Usernames too. We are a  Catholic Singles Meetup not a Public Relations one. I do hope you understand why we have these rules.  By the way we are tired of No Shows , so 3 No Shows you are Removed,. Plus I have questions that I would like to be answered seriously not with silly answers please.  Also I do prefer you to keep open your other Meetup Group's (if any)  you belong to, so we could get to know you too. That too if you don't you won't be accepted. There is really nothing to hide, only to share. Also if you are not an Active Person of our Meetup within 6 months you became a part of us you will be removed with that too,

Thank You

Hope to see you at our future Meetups,

Susan R , Amanda
results.name: NY & NJ Catholic Singles

results.description:
Updated April 18th, 2015

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

SPRING/SUMMER (Mar - Aug)

As the city warms up we play four times a week. We use Riverside Park on Tuesdays/Thursdays and Morningside Park for the weekend games.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave) 
- Sundays at 12pm, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave) 
- Tuesdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!) 
- Thursdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)

Damien
914-621-6522

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the C local (B on weekdays) to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball/softball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

+++

OTHER SEASONS...

WINTER (Nov - Feb)

During the colder months we generally play two times a week depending on weather. Our main location is Riverside Park with Morningside as a backup.

There are two days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field) 
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field) 
*Tuesdays/Thursdays at 6pm games don't last long due to decreasing sunlight.

FALL (Sep - Oct)

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave)
- Sundays at 4pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Thursdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)

results.description:
The New York City Cake Decorators Meetup was founded in 2006 and is the first and largest group of its kind based in New York City. Its number one priority is to afford its members the opportunity to hone their skills and craft in the art of sugar by providing extraordinary workshops. Benefits include discounts at select events; consultation with advanced cake designers and networking with sugar artists.

A sampling of the critically acclaimed cake artists we have conducted meetups with are: Anne Heap, Betty Van Norstrand, Bronwen Weber, Cakediva, Elisa Strauss, Janet Ben-Ami, Julie Bashore, Lauren Kitchens, Lauri Ditunno, Mike McCarey, Penny Stankiewicz, Ruth Drennan and Toba Garrett.

Our members are a talented, friendly, diverse group and warmly welcome anyone who has an avid interest in learning more about the art of decorating cakes, cookies and cupcakes. Whether you are a beginner or a seasoned professional…if you are really serious about improving/perfecting your sugar art skills, the NYC Decorators Meetup is for you! Please consider joining our esteemed group.

Best Wishes,

Ayana Kimi
Organizer

 

 

 

 

Disclaimer: We are NOT affiliated with  NY Cake Convention, or Cupcake Competition and Cake Show
results.name: The New York City Cake Decorators

WELCOME to the Separation and Divorce Legal Issues

 

Meet other local people coping with a separation or divorce for discussion and support.  All men and women that have gone through or are going through the process of a separation or divorce are invited to share their experiences and challenges and also to get their legal questions answered in a comfortable environment.

Jacqueline Harounian, a knowledgeable and compassionate law partner at Great Neck matrimonial and family law firm will lead this group. Jackie will help you to gain insight and information about your situation and about what to expect from the court process. It is a way to not feel so alone in this most challenging time.

There is no cost to attend. We hope you will join us and we look forward to meeting you.

Group will meet on the 



first and third Thursday of each month 



6:00 PM to 7:30 PM 



Facilitator: Jacqueline Harounian, Esq. 



Wisselman, Harounian & Associates, P.C. 



This group is joining together with the pre-separation thru post divorce legal clinic group ... as soon as I can figure out how to combine the two groups into one.  The benefits of a bigger group is that there will be more people to share with and get support from and there will be greater discussion opportunities.

1010 Northern Blvd. 



Great Neck, NY 



(near the corner of Community Drive)

Directions are on our website www.lawjaw.com.





RSVP recommended

The NYC Animal Advocacy Network is your portal into the animal rights landscape in New York City.  A quick check on our calendar will let you know activities and events are going on around town.

We are here to inform you of and participate in high-visibility demos, low-key advocacy and everything in between.  So if you want to DO something for the animals and meet like-minded people, this is the Meetup for you!

We are also committed to building community by organizing joint events with our sister veg Meetups, participating in potlucks and supporting local businesses by dining out. Further, we coordinate book clubs, outings to film screenings, lectures, presentations and workshops.  Grass roots!

But above all, we need YOU to join us and bring your energy, ideas, event notifications and passion for compassion!  New AOs and guest hosts are welcome!

Namasté.

results.description:
This meetup consists of different groups of people reading certain material to different degrees of depth and intensity. Books we've read in the past include Descartes' 'Meditations', Hume's 'Enquiry Concerning Human Understanding', Kant's '1st Critique', Kant's 'Prolegomena', Heidegger's 'Being and Time', Husserl's 'Logical Investigations', Hegel's 'Phenomenology of Spirit', Marx's 'Capital', and many others.

From time to time new groups are formed and remain open for awhile to newcomers.

If you join our meetup, you'll get an email as soon as any new group starts. No background in philosophy required. Feel free to propose a reading group topic or volunteer to organize one!

For a description of Continental Philosophy go to http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Continental_philosophy...

Events may be held in NYC, Brooklyn, Queens, Westchester, Long Island, etc., and we encourage you to plan a group outing. If you are expecting and close to delivery, you may also join.

Visit www.MotherhoodLater.com and read our blog. Sign up for the free email newsletter there and be entered to win cool prizes.

Having a family later in life can pose particular challenges, and Motherhood Later aims to create a community of friendship & support. Parenting is the experience of a lifetime, and the goal is that we share it and grow together.

Please be aware that this group is not to be used to promote other groups. We are working to build a network of sincere, like-minded women who became a mom at age 35+, and this is not a forum for any commercial or marketing messages.

results.description:
We meet in or near Prospect Park, Brooklyn, and have been playing since the summer of 2006, outside, year-round. You can read all about us here.

Our primary goal is to be welcoming to beginner players, but we are also interested in encouraging more women to start playing soccer. Complete and total beginners who have never touched a soccer ball in their lives are especially welcome!

Our games are either co-ed or women-only and are excruciatingly slow and overly friendly with lots of rules to keep it that way.

Please do not join this group if you have been playing soccer for a long time and are looking for a regular pick-up game.

 

HOW TO JOIN THIS GROUP:

  1. Read over our ABOUT page very carefully to make sure this is the group for you.
  2. Decide what skill level you are (see skill levels listed below) and keep that number in your head.
  3. Click the "join us" button and fill out the profile questions.

    NOTE: When you apply to join the group, all of the following are required or your application will be declined and you will have to reapply:
    • Use a close-up, recognizeable picture of yourself, with no one else in the picture
    • Introduce yourself for real, i.e., don't just say "hi",
    • Answer all of the questions, especially the one about your skill level (see levels below), and
    • Use your real first name, not a screen/nickname or initials.

SKILL LEVELS:

Level 1
Learning the very basics of the game. Have only the vaguest notion of what a soccer ball looks like. Just started playing recently, or haven't played since, like, one time in P.E. in sixth grade.

Level 2
Not a TOTAL beginner, but not quite intermediate yet. Have played for a little while, or started learning a long time ago but rarely play. Still working on the basics and screw up a lot. Can sort of pass, but super slow or non-existent on the footwork. Still trying to figure out how to keep people from stealing the ball so easily.

Level 3
More or less have the basics down, but just barely. Absolutely nothing fancy. Just really simple ball handling/dribbling, slow but mostly accurate passing, shooting, etc. Maybe played a little in school but not college. Can head the ball if necessary, but who knows where it will go? Still learning. Prefer a slower game. Note: You are probably better than a level three if you have been playing on and off since childhood.

Level 4
Solid player. Most people who learned to play as a kid are this level. Have been playing most of your life, on and off. Have ball handling skills, can head and switch the ball pretty comfortably, pass accurately most of the time. Maybe played on a few competitive leagues, or play a lot of pick up, and prefer a regular to fast-paced game.

Level 5 (and up)
Very good player. Play often.  Have played since you were young. Maybe played competitive or club soccer. Dribble easily at a run, can head and switch the ball confidently. Enjoy a faster, fairly intense, physical game.
results.name: Prospect Park (Beginner + Intermediate) Pick-up Soccer

results.description:
"If a man must be obsessed by something, I suppose a boat is as good as anything, and perhaps a bit better than most. A small sailing craft is not only beautiful, it is seductive and full of strange promise and the hint of trouble." - From The Sea and The Wind That Blows E. B. White -- 1899-1985" 

Meet with other sailing enthusiasts at our Meetup events, attend sailing education seminars, share stories, find skippers, find crew, and go sailing!!  Last year many members became crew on competitive racing boats, others learned to sail, and some went for day sails cruising around Long Island Sound. We offer through City Island Yacht Club, a Club Boat Timeshare that offers unlimited sailing on two Catalina 25's and a J/24.

This years Meet and Greet event included 90 skippers and  potential crew members connecting.  No sailing experience is necessary, we offer a range of seminars that appeal to all levels, from newbies to advanced sailors. Our Meetup events are held on City Island, about an hour's ride from Grand Central Station on the #6 Lexington Ave local plus a short bus (#29)  ride, also convenient to the Hutchinson River Parkway and the I-95. There is even a direct Express Bus that runs up Madison Ave right to City Island! ".

"Believe me, my young friend, there is nothing, absolutely nothing, half so much worth doing as simply messing about in boats. In them, out of them, it doesn't really matter" 
Kenneth Grahame, "The Wind in the Willows"
results.name: The Greater New York Sailing Group

results.description:
We are a diverse gathering of cool, chill young people with open minds and adventurous, eclectic tastes. What most of us have in common is a love of Neo-Soul; the music genre that fuses contemporary R&B, 1970s style soul, jazz, and elements of alternative-hip hop. But we also love Spoken Word, and have other musical interests like Afro-Beat, jazz, R&B, reggae, and even rock.

More than anything, what we love the most is making new friends, while having new experiences with an international flavor in the city at the crossroads of the world.

Most members are cool singles in their 20s-40s who are progressive and upbeat people from different backgrounds and heritages - from African to Asian descent, European to Eskimo, Latino to Lebanese, and everything in between.

WHAT DO WE DO? We love live music and spoken word - especially when we can meet the artists. We love meeting each other in a wide variety of venues with international flavor from hookah bars to sidewalk cafes to Dim Sum in Chinatown. We drink. We mingle. We chill. We laugh. We unwind. We appreciate the live performances. We applaud. We leave. We tell our friends. We return each month for more!

Members like you have made this group the best soiree on the planet! Please spread the word!
results.name: NYC Multi-Cultural Meetup

results.description: Meet local moms and dads for play dates and to talk about the awesome responsibility of being a parent. results.description:
Our mission is to provide a way for Poodle enthusiasts in NYC to participate in discussion forums and social gatherings and volunteering.

results.description:
Welcome to the New York Hungarian Social Network!

We are a community organization that was founded around the fall of 2006.

Our goal is to bring together Hungarians, Hungarian Americans and New Yorkers that have an interest in Hungary, its culture, or its people. We have held social, cultural and musical events in New York almost every month since we were founded. The member count this year has exceeded 1,100 thanks to the hard work of the organizers and volunteers who have helped to shape this group to what it is today.

Our members have come from all walks of lives, fields and professions. We promote friendships, social relationships, and provide members with an opportunity to network with local Hungarians and New Yorkers to build out business relationships.

The atmosphere of our Meetup events is friendly, inclusive, and the organizers always make sure that everyone has a good time.

This is a private group at the request of the members.

The registration only takes a few minutes - here is how it's done:

1. Copy this link into your browser:

http://www.meetup.com/hungarian-125/

2. Click on "Join us" in the upper right corner

3. Enter your name, your email and a password you want to use for this website, and click on "Sign up". The Meetup site will send you an email with instructions on how to confirm your registration.

4. Open the link in the that Meetup email, answer the entry questions and upload a valid picture of yourself.  Complete the registration and submit for approval.

results.description:
Welcome to our There's No Business Like Your Business Meetup Club!


Join us with ONE EASY Click - All Profile Questions Are Optional!

```````````````````````````````````````````

"Brand humility is the only response to a fast-changing and competitive marketplace. The humble brand understands that it needs to re-earn attention, re-earn loyalty and reconnect with its audience as if every day is the first day." --Seth Godin

Pondering these words from marketing expert, Seth Godin, while planning the future of this Meetup group, I know one thing that's for certain:

That the absolute truth behind this short statement summarizes a world of discovery and understanding about what we cannot and should not, as business owners forget about.

That every day brings more, new, fresh insights and opportunities to reconnect with our audience, fans, tribe, and customers. Another chance, to help others and make new friends!

Nor, should you forget that your businesses is unique and special because you work to make it so, and consistently strive to offer something different -- something better -- something more useful compared to what's already out there.

So what can you do every day to leverage on all the days before today? What can you do that costs you absolutely nothing?

Before checking email or returning those phone calls, why not start the day off by connecting first with your business-self, first?

Remind yourself just what it is that's so special about your business.

For a minute or two, reflect upon the valuable services you provide, the innovative products you've created, and especially the trust and respect you've earned from people who do business with you.

This little bit of time that you invest in yourself at the beginning of each day will pay off a thousand-fold with new wins and you'll reach your milestones a whole lot faster.

How does it work?

You've heard the expression, "pay yourself first"?

It's very much the same thing. Because when you invest a few, precious moments out the most valuable part of your day to reinforce your business confidence it'll stay with you all day long.

Now that you've established that, "There's No Business Like Your Business!" go ahead, answer the phone... or, better still, register for our next Meetup!

Hope to see you soon! -Zorka

Zorka Kovacevich

"Delivering on the Power and Promise of Technology"

Marketing Consultant

Networking/Meetup Groups Organizer

results.description:
The NYC Barn Dance was created by David Harvey in October 2006 as a monthly event designed to give New Yorkers an opportunity to experience - through dance - the traditional Anglo-Irish-Scottish dance music being played in the city and elsewhere. This experience stands in stark contrast to how this music is often experienced in NYC: at spaces where dancing is difficult or prohibited. Solid turnout and strong reviews by attendees and musicians have all served as proof that the event is a welcome and valuable addition to the New York City social landscape. The Barn Dance is a fully participatory, traditional, social dance event, and attendees are invited to participate as dancers regardless of experience.

The dances we do are old-time squares from southern Appalachia.  People are friendly here and are willing to dance with each other, so there's no harm in coming alone.  We make sure that everyone who wants to get out on the floor does so the whole night long!

You should also know that we teach and walk-through all dances.  The teaching is efficient because we all want to get on to the dancing!  This event is a dance party, not a dance class!

Come join us for a night of lively dancing to live music!

 

Yours,

Dave Harvey

Event Organizer

Service businesses drive more than half of the U.S. economy. Among you are photographers, contractors, web designers; enterprising and innovative service providers from all industries and fields... The one thing we have in common is that we're service businesses!

Perhaps you're planning your first business. Maybe you've been around for decades. Our group discusses everything from starting up to marketing and expanding.

Ciao!  Welcome to ITALIAN CHAT, a place for Italian-language enthusiasts!

We are a friendly and diverse group of over 1,600 Italian speakers and learners from the NYC area, and we meet two or more times a month at a local venue to share our passion for the Italian language, culture and lifestyle with like-minded people.

ITALIAN CHAT is organized by Legaitaliana / Italian Connection, an international association on Italian language and culture. Our non-profit organization oversees Italian-language groups in 6 cities around the world, totalling over 6,000 members. Learn more at Legaitaliana.org

Our events are designed for people who want to practice or improve their Italian-language skills over a drink or a bite to eat in a relaxed and friendly atmosphere, and make new amici while doing so. The idea is simply to speak Italian and meet others who enjoy speaking it too!

Membership is FREE, and all ages and levels of proficiency are welcome!

If you are a business owner and would like to sponsor this Meetup group, contact Walter, the Co-Organizer (thatswalter@yahoo.com).

Ci vediamo,

LEGA ITALIANA / ITALIAN CONNECTION
