results.description:
Join us for a full range of outdoor activities all year round!

• Day hikes ranging from short relaxing hikes to 20 mile hiking challenges 

• Weekend camping and backpacking trips across the northeast (Catskills, Adirondacks, White Mountains)

• Rock scrambling and rock climbing

• Winter snowshoeing, mountaineering and ice climbing

• Cross-country, downhill, and backcountry AT Skiing

• Adventure travel all over the world - we've been hiking in Iceland, diving in Belize, on lots of place in between 

• Bagging 14ers like Whitney, Rainer, and Elbert

Most local trips are accessible via public transportation and we organize car pools when they are not.

These are not guided trips - these are social events. Remember that you are responsible for your own safety. Stay within your skill, fitness, and experience level.

      Most day hikes are suitable for any fit individual with some prior hiking experience.

      Everyone should be comfortable hiking alone and be prepared to do so (with a map and an understanding of the route). We make an effort to stay together as a group, but sometimes the group does need to split up. 

      If you're new to a particular activity or moving “up a level”, please contact the event organizer. It is often possible to accommodate less experienced members, but not always.

Check out our Facebook Page.

If you do not have any hiking experience at all, please hike with a professional guide service a few times.

If you'd like to join us, just:

1) Read the About Us page for membership guidelines and a few ground rules

2) Have a profile photo showing your face. This is required so your organizers can remember who's who.

3) And answer all the profile questions so we know a little about you and what kind of events we should plan

See you on the trails!

-Andre

Hiking - Hiking - Hiking - Hiking - Hiking - Hiking
results.name: Hiking & Nature Meetup

results.description:
Join us if you love going out and love soulful house music. We will post all the best parties happening regularly plus very special events coming to our great city. We'll also post important events like Winter Music Conference, The Nightclub and Bar Expo and Conference and other industry events that support great house music. 

The group was launched as a tribute to weekly parties in NYC featuring a soulful deep house vibe and we will continue that tradition with the addition of the types of dance music that compliment house such as the sounds of the Paradise Garage, The Loft, Studio 54 (at times), Bond International, The Palladium (Union Square when it was credible) and so on. 

Keeping the deep soulful house music tradition alive and well in New York!

Unite House Music (UHM) is a group of “House Heads” friends and associates all connected by this thing called House Music and its culture. We are a driven by the Love of House Music.  UHM is made up of talented individuals, Artist, Dancers and House Heads.  Together using resources, products and services we can make things happen for and within our own community.

P.S. - Visit us at www.UniteHouseMusic.com

Thanks for your support family!
results.name: NYC House Music Movement

results.description:
NJ SCUBA Meetup is a group of local divers dedicated to SCUBA Diving and "Education Beyond the C-Card", Dive Safety and having fun. Visitors are always welcome!
If you are a Diver or want to learn there's good news for you. NJ SCUBA Meetup is the choice to make. The Group brings together divers from all areas of interest; Recreational, Technical and Public Safety, embracing every activity in SCUBA today. Whatever your interests are or wherever you want to dive? Membership in the NJ SCUBA Group is indispensable. More importantly the group addresses the diverse needs of individuals and the interests of the sport as a whole. No matter what other organizations you belong to membership is still beneficial. No other group serves you and SCUBA as a whole like NJ SCUBA Meetup will. We want to create a culture where every diver can progress at their pace and level of comfort. No pressure, no stress, just a straight forward learning experience
There are various levels of membership.

Our Local Dive Shop http://www.1877scubausa.com/
results.name: NJ  Scuba Meetup Group

results.description:
Hi Fellow Wanderers You should join this group if you want to exercise and meet some great people. The walk is quite beautiful and scenic - expect to see raccoons, hawks, rare birds, exotic plants and trees. If you have a dog and want to take them, feel free but you can't leave them off leash. Bring your friends as well. We will take guided tours of historic neighborhoods. I am an expert tour guide and have been leading these tours for many years. To find out more about me, join me on Facebook: William Gati. See you there! Bill Please go to http://www.hopstop.com/ for public transit directions and http://www.mapquest.com/ for driving or walking directions.

The Happy Wanderer I love to go a-wandering, Along the mountain track, And as I go, I love to sing, My knapsack on my back. Chorus: Val-deri,Val-dera, Val-deri, Val-dera-ha-ha-ha-ha-ha Val-deri,Val-dera. My knapsack on my back. I love to wander by the stream That dances in the sun, So joyously it calls to me, "Come! Join my happy song!" I wave my hat to all I meet, And they wave back to me, And blackbirds call so loud and sweet From ev'ry green wood tree. High overhead, the skylarks wing, They never rest at home But just like me, they love to sing, As o'er the world we roam. Oh, may I go a-wandering Until the day I die! Oh, may I always laugh and sing, Beneath God's clear blue sky!
results.name: Wanderers

results.description:
We are located in the beautiful lower Hudson Valley region. Rockland County is just a few miles from Westchester NY, Bergen County NJ, Manhattan and Connecticut.

Meet with a local group of Lightworkers, healers, holistic practitioners and those interested in Reiki, healing modalities and spiritually based programs.

At the Light Within Us we welcome all levels of experience and interest. Over the years we have grown into a wonderful and supportive spiritually illuminated community.

Our interests include Reiki, Meditation, Spiritual Growth, Angels, Intuition, Past Life Regression, Enlightenment, Mediumship, Channeling, Vibrational and Sound Healing, Body - Mind & Spirit, Crystal Healing, E.F.T. (Emotional Freedom Technique), Ascension, Visualization Techniques, Shamanism, Chanting, Drumming, Munay Ki, Nature, Green Living, Homeopathy, Essential Oils, Acupuncture, Chinese Herbs, Breath Work, and Chakra Balancing.

We encourage and support your spiritual growth, personal healing and well-being.

Some guidelines:

Your introduction and profile- Please tell us a little about yourself. It's a wonderful way to connect. Using a photo of yourself is another great way for us to get to"see" you!

RSVP's and attendance- If you rsvp'd for an event and for some reason can not attend, please update your rsvp OR text or call the organizer at 845-222-6923. It's a courtesy thing and we greatly appreciate your cooperation!

Your rsvp for an event tells us that you will be attending and we will hold a seat for you. Habitual no-shows (3 or more) will be result in the forfeiting  your membership with The Light Within Us, and arrangements to rejoin can only be made through the organizer. 

Some events may require a pre-payment to attend. Should your payment not be received by the required date, your reservation shall be released to another member.

Thank you for your understanding and cooperation.

Love and Light,

Julie
results.name: The Light Within Us- A Spiritually Illuminated Community

results.description:
Inspired by indigenous cultures and modern tribes and compelled by sacred reverence for Earth and Life, StorySpiral NYC creates individual and collective openings into recovering the unconditioned, undiminished, untamed human identity.

Our programs emphasize storytelling and direct experiencing in order to access a way of being in community that springs from the very core of Life that is diversity, synergy, and evolution. We support each other as we discover ways to embody those essential qualities within an evolving cultural, social, and economic context. We learn about and contribute to emergent forms of organizing human activity that express the timeless truth of interdependence and interconnectedness.
results.name: StorySpiral NYC

results.description:
"Since only the mind can be sick, only the mind can be healed. Only the mind is in need of healing."
—"PSYCHOTHERAPY: Purpose, Process and Practice," Supplements to A Course in Miracles

Hello, all miracle workers & seekers! We are dedicated teachers and students of A Course in Miracles (ACIM) who are waiting to share miracles with you through our ACIM-based Healing. We ask the Holy Spirit to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and we share forgiveness and bear witness to the miracles that are happening in all areas of your life. Bring any issue you are facing right now — physically, emotionally, mentally, spiritually, or whatever — or just bring your shining spirit, and receive a short session of energy work.

You will experience healing by the Holy Spirit through our healers' hands. Together, we create a Holy Triangle, consisting of the Holy Spirit and two brothers (you and a healer), to be the witnesses of miracles together. Together, we can help each other to accept God’s love! After your healing we might whisper to you a brief message that we receive from the Holy Spirit about what is going on in your energy field. Otherwise, we don't talk or discuss ACIM during this meetup event. We share healing quietly instead and provide you with an opportunity to come to rest, reflect, and remember who you truly are, in a supportive, non-judgmental, meditative environment.

So, rather than offering your advice, we'd like to offer you an opportunity to experience stillness of mind and peace so that you can return to harmony with your true nature and purpose. Then you will find that rather than needing "solutions" to "problems" you will realize that you have no problems except those that you project. We call this spiritual healing but it is not religious nor connected with any church or group. It is simply a practice of meditating together on our true nature and connecting with universal spirit/energy or what you will.

Schedule:

Mondays from 7 – 7:50 pm
Tuesdays from 7 – 7:50 pm
Thursdays from 11 – 11:50 am 
Suggested donation $20. No one is turned away.

Location:

CRS (Center for Remembering & Sharing) 
123 4th Ave, 2nd FL (between 12th & 13th Streets) 
Manhattan 
http://www.crsny.org
212-677-8621

A Note About the Role of Words in Healing:

"Strictly speaking, words play no part at all in healing. The motivating factor is prayer, or asking. What you ask for you receive. But this refers to the prayer of the heart, not to the words you use in praying. Sometimes the words and the prayer are contradictory; sometimes they agree. It does not matter. God does not understand words, for they were made by separated minds to keep them in the illusion of separation. Words can be helpful, particularly for the beginner, in helping concentration and facilitating the exclusion, or at least the control, of extraneous thoughts. Let us not forget, however, that words are but symbols of symbols. They are thus twice removed from reality...." — A Course in Miracles Manual for Teachers, Section 21
results.name: Walk-In Spiritual Healing Clinic

results.description:
ATTN: Read this description entirely. Only apply for membership if you think this group is a good fit for you. We're picky.

Before requesting membership, please post an identifiable picture of yourself into your meetup profile so that members could recognize you at our events. Only profiles with photos will be approved.

If you were born in the former USSR, or have any cultural or emotional ties with Russia and its parts, this group is for you! We are a society of active, young (20's - 30's), physically fit and adventurous people with healthy social and professional lives. Our goal is to make new friends, have fun, and contribute to the social value of the group.

We're a group that meets OFFLINE regularly. Our past activities included hiking/skiing trips, opera nights, wine tastings, wall climbing, bowling, movies, comedy clubs, happy hours, bicycle rides, picnics, museum outings, and much, much more.

Since mid-2007, we had over 280 events. Our team has grown strong and great relationships have formed. Many members have been continuously contributing to the group in some way, be it carpooling, places to gather, ideas on future fun events, information about cool places to visit in the city, professional expertise, or simply good mood and great conversation. We're very diverse.

Our members are 20-40 y/o and all fluent in Russian. If you are outside this range or simply want to learn the language, please search meetup.com for a more appropriate group in your area.

To join our group, click "Join Us!" button at the top.

results.description:
OurNextDate.com is a social networking website that introduces Couples with similar interests 

After years of giving others advice about New York’s best date spots, professional event planner, Cari and her husband launched OurNextDate.com to share their secrets, helping singles and two-somes plan their next date and build a network of friends through unique themed events from Beer Tastings and Culinary Events to Wine Tastings and Walking Tours.

OurNextDate.com allows Couples to create personalized profiles that include photos, occupation, location and hobbies and search for other like mined people on the website to attend events with. 

OND organizes and hosts monthly social events. In addition, the website provides users access to hundreds of events going on throughout New York City. OND's monthly newsletter highlights some of the best date ideas, restaurant suggestions and things to do in and around the city. 

OurNextDate.com was created by young married couple, Cari & Keith DeCoons. Cari, a native New Yorker and Keith, a Boston implant were always looking for new things to do around the city and found that once they were married, had fewer people to do these things with. So,when the opportunity to take over as the new organizers of a Couples Meet Up Group presented itself, they quickly rose to the challenge. The OurNextDate.com meetup group is now approaching close to 500 couples. They've made some great friends along the way and wanted to create an on and off-line community that allowed others to share the same experience.

The website was created as a hub for all things OurNextDate.com related; to help Couples meet other Couples to socialize with and provide everyone with a variety of events and activities for them to meet at.

OurNextDate.com...because it's never to early too start planning!
results.name: Our Next Date: Couples Meet Up

results.description:
New York Small Business Support & Networking Group.


If You're Looking For Support & Networking, We Aim To Be Your Group!

 

In this group, it's "business as usual"

which means it's when you improve on how you do business

so does your professional life!



...if you need a great sales letter or content writer, help with automating your social media marketing campaigns, recommendation for a good business accountant, or maybe you want to sublease some commercial space?

Perhaps you need advice on managing cash flow? Or, even maybe you'd just like to vent about the pressures of running a business? Or, are looking for the best alternative funding sources?

How about free business services like help with bootstrapping; employee training, professional coaching/mentoring, or information about the almost unlimited world of free services available to startups and well-oiled ventures?

For this group, our mission is to provide you with state-of-the-art tools, resources, learning, networking and socializing opportunities with our doors wide open to ALL relevant subjects and topics which benefit business growth, creation of our art, or if we determined turn turn our jobs into professions!

 

If you like to connect through sharing, please email the group with your events and opportunities, business questions and advice, requests for recommendations or resources. Or, email me directly; my personal email address is below.

If it's about business, please let us know about it! Can we help?

Networking and other business related events will be posted as meetups as often as possible.


All are welcome to explore the opportunities within this group and we welcome your comments and questions.

results.description:
We are a social club for New Zealanders living in the New York City area. The club has been around since the 1980's and became an incorporated non-profit in 1994. We are financially independent from, but operate on good terms with, the New Zealand Consulate General in New York. We are also separate from, but friendly with, KEA (Kiwi Expats Association), a business networking group. We are run by a board of unpaid volunteers, who are all young Kiwi professionals living in or near NYC. 

We welcome to our club anyone who is a New Zealander or just likes meeting New Zealanders. We hold free open monthly drinks nights, a Kiwi-style summer barbecue, an annual Christmas party, and various other events. Our members range from single professionals to young families to long established expats. We have a financial membership option of $25 a year (individual) $35 (household) which gives you discounts to all our ticketed events and occasionally special offers (e.g. cheap legs of fresh NZ lamb!). Come along to our events and find out how many Kiwis there are in New York whom you already know from home! And see our website, http://www.kiwiclubny.org/.

THERE IS NO FEE TO HAVE FUN WITH US . Meet us, learn dance, or simply dance with us :)  Only fees for meetups which involve renting space to train you in Bhangra.

Since 2007 NYC Bhangra has been a dance institution for performing arts to actively energize students/audience/members about Indian dance forms and promote cultural festival events like 'Holi'.

results.description:
WELCOME WORLD CITIZENS!

New York City is a place rich in cultural diversity; with residents from every country in the world. This makes NYC the ideal place to host the New York City WORLD TOURNAMENT 2012! Check out last year’s final: NYC WORLD SOCCER YouTube channel. Also checkout the story done about us by AssociatedPress.

Videos

Winners

How do I join the tournament?
There are 3 ways to join the tournament:

1. First way to join is by clicking on the link below and joining one of the listed teams (if the team does not have a captain, you can become the captain. Please e-mail Aia to become a captain. All teams must have a captain:)

2. The second way to join is as an individual player. To join as an individual player please rsvp onthis page and we will place you on a team. If you would like to be placed with a friend on the same team, please let us know. We will try to accommodate everyone :)

3. The third way to join is as a team. If you would like to register your team, please contact Aia or Paul to for a special team discount. Thank you!

How will the tournament work?
-We are looking to register at least 16 teams. 
-Once teams are registered, we will have a team draw like FIFA to create groups.
- The first round consists of 3 games.
- The top 2 teams in each group will make it to the knockout round (sudden elimination round)

What's the cost and what is the refund policy?
- $49 dollars for individual players. If you join as an individual player, we will place you on a team.
- If you have a team already please contact us for our special reduced team fee.
- The deadline to receive a refund is March 20th.

What's included?
- 3 first round games (half of the teams will move to the next round).
- Hired referees
- Permit fees
- FIFA match balls
- League and website administration
- Part of the proceeds will be donated to the winning team's charity.

When do we play?
See schedule on this link: The schedule will be posted after Jan 1, 2012

Where will we play?
Booker T. Washington Field on W108st between Amsterdam and Columbus Ave.
Google link: Click Booker T. Field

What are the rules and level of play?
- 8vs8 (includes the goalkeeper)
- CO-ED
- Full size goals.
- Two 25 minute halves.
- Level is intermediate to advance. If you played at a college level, you would be considered Advanced.
- No sliding. You must wear turf shoes or running shoes. NO CLEATS ALLOWED. YOU WILL NOT BE ALLOWED TO PLAY WITH CLEATS OF ANY TYPE. YOU MUST WEAR TURF OR RUNNING SHOES.

- For the full set of rules follow this link:
 Rules

** PLEASE NOTE: You cannot RSVP until you have paid here via PayPal. Once the tournament is full, we will open up a waiting list for those that didn't get a chance to register.**

_____________________________________________________________________________

If you would like to check out our weekly pick-up games and pictures please visit our other page:

www.nycpickup.org


PLEASE READ OUR TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF USE CAREFULLY.
BY USING THIS WEBSITE, YOU AGREE TO THESE TERMS AND CONDITIONS.

results.description:
Our events are targeted to upscale/polished professionals ages 21-55 who are looking to make new social contacts. We host weekly speeddating events and various types of happy hours and other social mixers.  I hope you'll join us, as I'm sure you could add great value to our groups.

Be sure to check your new member welcome email for a discount code to be used towards select events as a thank you for joining the group.

See our dating advice website AndThatsWhyYoureSingle.com for great tips!
results.name: Events for 20's, 30's & 40's Single Manhattan Professionals

results.description:
If you are new to Hoboken or just looking to make some new friends, we will be hosting lots of events for your mingling pleasure.

Meeting people at events is the best way to broaden your social circle and make new friends. The purpose of this group is to provide a venue where you can meet new people in a friendly atmosphere while exploring new places in Hoboken.
This group is open to everyone who has a positive attitude, lives in or very near Hoboken NJ and wants to meet new people. Almost all of our events are in Hoboken. If you are looking for Hiking events, they are posted on our Biking and Hiking group at:

http://www.meetup.com/nj-bike-eat-drink/

While this group does not have an Official age requirement, our crowd is generally in the 22 to 45 age range.

To see what an event is like, check out the YouTube clip from one of our bar crawls at:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z9wmAsvcgxM
results.name: " Hoboken Social Sandbox "

results.description:
We're not looking for numbers of group members, we're looking for numbers of riders!

If you Love to ride, you're in the right place.

We ride the entire Northeast at this point and we are expanding our range of trails. See "North East Trails" on the Group's Message Board.

We are mainly an Intermediate to Intermediate plus All Mountain/XC group of riders. We do hold beginner rides, regularly, for those wanting to enter the world of Mountain Biking. Some of our riders also hit the Downhill Park every now and then.

We usually set up Big Rides for the weekend days and Local rides for during the week.

The only way to get better is to ride more. Come out and expand your skills.
results.name: TriState Westchester Mountain Bikers (TSWMTB)
